title: Resume content updates, deduplication, and Technical Projects desktop grid fix

requirements.summary: Add the “Programming & Front-End Development (Self-Learner)” experience entry and render it as a standard Experience card.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/content/resumeContent.ts` includes a new `experience` entry titled exactly “Programming & Front-End Development (Self-Learner)” with bullet points derived from the provided text.
The Experience section (`frontend/src/components/portfolio/ExperienceSection.tsx`) displays the new entry as a normal experience card with the same spacing/typography as existing entries.
All user-facing text for this new entry is in English.

file_operations.description: Add a new `resumeContent.experience` item titled exactly “Programming & Front-End Development (Self-Learner)” with company/period/location fields populated in English and bullets derived from the provided description (C++ fundamentals, HTML/CSS responsive design, front-end layouts, UI structuring, clean code practices, ongoing learning in automation/full-stack concepts, healthcare workflow optimization focus).

requirements.summary: Add the “Revenue Cycle Management (RCM) — Medical Billing & Corporate Case” technical project and render it as a project card with tools and focus tags.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/content/resumeContent.ts` includes a new `projects` entry with title “Revenue Cycle Management (RCM)” and description/subtitle text that clearly includes “Medical Billing & Corporate Case”.

The new project includes bullet points that cover: denial management, AR follow-ups, eligibility verification, payment posting, and clean claim submission; and includes the “22 U.S. practices” detail.
The new project includes technologies/tools badges that include: Waystar, Office Ally, eProviderSolutions, and Multiple EHRs (spelled as provided).
The new project includes “Focus” tags represented either as bullets or as technologies/badges, containing: Denials, AR, Eligibility, Reimbursements.
The Technical Projects section (`frontend/src/components/portfolio/ProjectsSection.tsx`) renders the new project card without layout overflow or misalignment.

file_operations.description: Add a new `resumeContent.projects` item with title “Revenue Cycle Management (RCM)” and description that includes “Medical Billing & Corporate Case”, bullets covering denial management, AR follow-ups, eligibility verification, payment posting, clean claim submission, and explicitly “22 U.S. practices”; include `technologies` badges containing Waystar, Office Ally, eProviderSolutions, Multiple EHRs, plus Focus tags (Denials, AR, Eligibility, Reimbursements) as badges or bullets (keep all text in English).
Ensure the new RCM project card displays cleanly: long tool/badge lists wrap without overflow, and card header/description spacing matches existing card styling (no layout misalignment).

requirements.summary: Deduplicate repeated facts between Experience and Technical Projects while preserving meaning and completeness.
acceptanceCriteria: After adding the new entries, no identical or near-identical sentences appear across `resumeContent.experience` and `resumeContent.projects` for the same claim/tooling details.
If a detail is removed to avoid duplication, the remaining location still communicates the detail clearly (no loss of key information).
The rendered Experience and Technical Projects sections do not visibly repeat the same tool list and the same “22 U.S. practices” statement in both sections.

file_operations.description: Edit existing Experience and/or Projects bullets to remove duplicated facts across sections (specifically avoid repeating the exact “22 U.S. practices” claim and the exact tool list in both `experience` and `projects`), keeping each key detail once in the most appropriate section while maintaining clear meaning in English.

If needed after content deduplication, refine rendering so updated Experience bullets remain readable and consistent (spacing/typography unchanged, no new UI components, and no repeated tool/metric statements introduced by formatting).

requirements.summary: Fix Technical Projects desktop layout to show two cards per row with consistent spacing and no horizontal scrolling.
acceptanceCriteria: On desktop widths, the Technical Projects section displays a 2-column grid when there are 2+ projects.
On mobile widths, the Technical Projects section remains single-column and readable.
Cards in the grid have consistent heights/spacing (no broken alignment or uneven gutters) and match the existing card styling used elsewhere.
No horizontal scrolling is introduced by the layout changes.

file_operations.description: Adjust the Technical Projects cards container to reliably render a 2-column grid on desktop widths (and 1-column on mobile), and ensure the grid uses consistent gutters/alignment; ensure cards stretch evenly in the grid (e.g., keep cards `h-full`/`items-stretch` behavior as needed) without introducing horizontal scrolling.

requirements.summary: Align spacing and typography for Experience and Technical Projects sections to match the existing professional theme and interaction patterns.
acceptanceCriteria: Experience and Technical Projects sections use consistent spacing between headings, descriptions, and bullet lists (no cramped or misaligned elements).
Typography sizing/weights for titles and descriptions match existing section patterns (e.g., SectionShell heading + CardTitle/CardDescription usage).
Hover/focus states remain consistent with existing card interactions (no regressions in card borders/shadows on hover).

file_operations.description: Normalize spacing/typography hierarchy inside Experience cards (title/meta/bullets) to match other portfolio sections, keeping existing hover/focus behavior and using only composed existing UI components (no edits under `frontend/src/components/ui`).

Normalize spacing/typography hierarchy inside Technical Projects cards (header/description/bullets/badges) so it matches the site’s established patterns and maintains existing hover/focus states; ensure consistent visual alignment across cards in the desktop grid.
